Terminology: Vaaloria is inhabited by the Vaalorian people, who are called Vaalorians.

Future

General

Capital City: Elnor (Only organized community left)

In the future the kingdom of Vaaloria lies in ruins. Due to the sturdy nature of their construction, many buildings remain mostly intact, though all are very worn, many showing signs of fire and other evidence of massive warfare. Traveling to the old capital city of Vaalnor, as well as many of the smaller towns in the kingdom is nearly impossible, save for the heartiest travelers.

Government

Little of the structure of the once large and bureaucratic government remains. Decisions are made by a small council of elders, however the head of the council is still called the Myadon as it was in the glory days of the kingdom. Structure is fairly simple. There are 8 members excluding the Myadon. The Myadon does not vote on issues except to break a tie vote. The Myadon's main function is as a judge for trials. There is no official record kept, and no real libraries, though a few people in Elnor still have managed to find and retrieve fairly extensive collections. Many of their books are old, worn, and missing parts.

Economy

Most of the remaining inhabitants of the once great kingdom live in fear in small communities built high into the trees. Commerce between villages is almost non-existent due to the dangerous nature of traveling any large distance. Some people run small shops in the tree villages selling small goods and a few weapons such as knives and daggers.

Architecture

Since most people live high in the trees now, most of the houses are of wooden construction covered with thatching from leaves and sticks and grasses that have been gathered. Large wooden beams cut from trees support wooden platforms on which many things are built.

Having much knowledge and understanding of nature they seem to have a talent to shape plants and trees to their liking and for particular purposes, e.g. bridge supports, storage areas, city walls, aqueduct (redirecting water to some central store or so?)

Past

General

Capital City: Vaalnor

Insert General Info Here

Economy

Vaaloria is a kingdom with a very diverse population. In the surrounding farmland, farmers traditionally grow maize and barley. Many of the larger towns including the capital city Vaalnor have large market areas where people from many places gather to sell goods. Farmers are important and make an excellent income. Though trade and blacksmith shops exist, most goods are imported from surrounding areas.

Architecture Styles

Most of the buildings in Vaaloria are of sturdy stone construction. In nearby ancient dry riverbeds lithified sediment rock is quarried. Limestone, Sandstone and Slate are common here, though limestones greater strength makes it a the most popular choice of building materials. Town housing districts are usually well constructed stone buildings, usually two stories high. Rural farm houses are of a more typical wooden construction, typically with slate roofs. Due to its diversity the overall architecture is a montage of slightly differing styles making it a truly unique place to visit.

Major Cities
